intro: Astragalus bubaloceras subsp. peudohamosus, commonly known as the false hoary vetch, is a flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Mongolia. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems, which help it retain moisture in dry environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. This subspecies is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
